name: Cisco Webex
description: This app integrates with Cisco Webex to implement investigative and genric actions
latest_tested_versions: Cisco webex api v1 tested on 9th May, 2025

scope.description: Scopes (Append extra space-seperated scopes which are added during app creation from webex portal)
scope.default: spark:people_read spark:rooms_read spark:messages_write spark:rooms_write spark:memberships_write spark:messages_read meeting:participants_read meeting:schedules_read meeting:recordings_read meeting:schedules_write

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Get user ID from e-mail address
Send message to user or room

actions.verbose:
• Public rooms require a description.
  • Announcement mode requires the room to be locked.
  • Team rooms cannot be locked.
  • Requires permission: spark:rooms_write.

title.description: A user-friendly name for the room

team_id.description: The ID for the team with which this room is associated

is_locked.description: Set the space as locked/moderated; creator becomes a moderator

is_public.description: If true, the room is discoverable by anyone in the org; description must be provided

is_announcement_only.description: Sets the space into announcement-only mode

actions.description: Add a people to a Webex room (space) as a member or moderator
actions.verbose: Adds a person to a Webex room using their ID or email. You can optionally assign them as a moderator. Requires `spark:memberships_write` scope. Compliance officers cannot add users to empty team spaces.

room_id.description: The ID of the room to add the person to

person_id.description: The ID of the person to add (use either person_id or person_email)

person_email.description: The email address of the person to add (use either person_email or person_id)

is_moderator.description: Set to true to make the person a room moderator

actions.description: Allows users to schedule a Webex meeting, webinar, or ad-hoc meeting
actions.verbose:
• To create a public meeting (public_meeting=true), your Webex admin must turn on this feature. If not, it will show an error.
  • OAuth Scopes: meeting:schedules_write, meeting:admin_schedule_write. Also, make sure the user has the right access (for example, a webinar license if you're creating webinars). Check required scopes
  • Use standard time zone names like America/New_York or Asia/Kolkata. This sets the correct time zone for your meeting. If you don’t set it, Webex will use the host’s time zone. See full list of time zones
  • If you want the meeting to repeat (daily, weekly, etc.), use the recurrence field. You must write it in a special format called RFC 5545.
    Example: FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO,WE,FR (means every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday)
    More about recurrence rules
  • If you're creating an ad-hoc meeting (adhoc=true), you must give a roomId (Webex space ID).
    In this case, hostEmail will be ignored — the meeting will use the Webex space owner as host.

timezone.description: IANA time zone for the meeting (e.g., America/Los_Angeles)

scheduled_type.description: Type of meeting: meeting, webinar, or personal_room_meeting

adhoc.description: Create an ad‑hoc (instant) meeting in a room

allow_any_user_to_be_co_host.description: Allow any qualified user to be cohost

enabled_join_before_host.description: Allow attendees to join before host

join_before_host_minutes.description: Minutes attendees can join before host (0,5,10,15)

enable_automatic_lock.description: Automatically lock the meeting after start

reminder_time.description: Minutes before start to send host reminder

unlocked_meeting_join_security.description: How non‑invitees join: allowJoin, allowJoinWithLobby, blockFromJoin

actions.description: Retrieve all participants in an in-progress or ended Webex meeting
actions.verbose: Retrieve a list of participants from a specific Webex meeting instance or series

meeting_id.description: Unique identifier of the meeting (not personal room meeting)

breakout_session_id.description: Unique ID of a breakout session in an ended meeting

meeting_start_time_from.description: Start time to filter meetings (ISO 8601 format)

meeting_start_time_to.description: End time to filter meetings (ISO 8601 format)

host_email.description: Email address of the meeting host (admin-only use)

join_time_from.description: Start of participant join time range (ISO 8601 format)

join_time_to.description: End of participant join time range (ISO 8601 format)

limit.description: Max number of participants to return (1–100)

actions.description: Retrieve a list of messages from a Webex room or 1:1 conversation

room_id.description: The ID of the room to list messages from

parent_id.description: List messages in a thread by parent message ID

before.description: List messages sent before a specific date/time (ISO 8601 format)

before_message.description: List messages sent before a specific message ID

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to return (default 50, max 100)

actions.description: Retrieve the details of a specific Webex message by message ID

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve

actions.description: Retrieve details of a specific Webex meeting using meeting ID or meeting number

meeting_id.description: The unique identifier of the meeting being requested (UUID format)

host_email.description: Email address of the meeting host (for admin-level access)

current.description: Whether to retrieve only the current scheduled meeting of the series (true or false)

actions.description: List users in your Webex organization using filters like email, name, ID, roles, or location

display_name.description: Filter people whose name starts with this string

id.description: Comma-separated list of person IDs to retrieve (max 85)

org_id.description: List users in this organization (admin only)

roles.description: Comma-separated list of role IDs to filter by (admin only)

calling_data.description: Whether to include Webex Calling data (admin only)

location_id.description: List users present in this location (admin only)

limit.description: Maximum number of people to return (default 100, max varies based on flags)

actions.description: Retrieve details of a Webex meeting recording using its recording ID

recording_id.description: Unique identifier of the Webex recording.

meeting_id.description: Unique identifier of the Webex meeting.

host_email.description: Email address of the meeting host (admin only).

example_values: Message: Recording details retrieved successfully, Status code: False

actions.description: Retrieve AI-Generated meeting summary and actions items using its recording ID and site url

recording_id.description: Unique identifier of the Webex recording.

site_url.description: Unique identifier of the Webex recording.eg: company.webex.com

example_values: AI-Generated meeting summary and actions items retrieved successfully
AI-Generated meeting summary and actions items retrieved successfully

actions.description: Updates details for a room, by ID.
actions.verbose:
Specify the room ID in the roomId parameter in the URI.
A space can only be put into announcement mode when it is locked.
Any space participant or compliance officer can convert a space from public to private. Only a compliance officer can convert a space from private to public and only if the space is classified with the lowest category (usually public), and the space has a description.
To remove a description please use a space character by itself.

room_id.description: The unique identifier for the room.  example = "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0"
room_id.name: room_id

team_id.description: The teamId to which this space should be assigned. Only unowned spaces can be assigned to a team. Assignment between teams is unsupported.
team_id.name: team_id

title.description: A user-friendly name for the room.
title.name: title

is_locked.description: Set the space as locked/moderated and the creator becomes a moderator
is_locked.name: is_locked

is_public.description: The room is public and therefore discoverable within the org. Anyone can find and join that room. When true the description must be filled in.
is_public.name: is_public

is_read_only.description: A compliance officer can set a direct room as read-only, which will disallow any new information exchanges in this space, while maintaing historical data.
is_read_only.name: is_read_only
